p: Influenza virus infection can induce a vigorous cytokine storm in airways and lungs, which promotes the recruitment of inflammatory cell. IFNγ as a pivotal antiviral cytokine is expressed early after influenza virus infection [ 41]. It has been demonstrated that CD8T RM cells activate rapidly when they re-encounter the cognate antigen and provide protection by secreting cytokines such as IFNγ and granzyme B [ 42, 43]. Morabito et al. showed that intranasal immunization with an MCMV-based vaccine vector induced CD8T RM cells and IFNγ was secreted at the very early time upon challenge during RSV infection [ 29].
